definition: To move a body part in a rhythmic back-and-forth motion, typically involving the tail, as a form of communication or expression of emotion. This action is commonly observed in certain animals, particularly dogs, to convey excitement, happiness, or friendliness.

examples.german: Der Hund wedelt mit dem Schwanz.
Er wedelte mit dem Handtuch, um sich abzukühlen.
examples.english: He waved the towel to cool himself down.
The flag fluttered in the wind.

examples.german: Der Fächer wedelte sanft hin und her.
examples.english: The fan gently waved back and forth.

examples.german: Die Kinder wedelten mit den Händen, um Hallo zu sagen.
examples.english: The children waved their hands to say hello.
